# Draft:King Moot (Musician)

| occupation        =

Robert Graff, known professionally as King Moot, is a British music producer.
Early Career
In the mid-2000s, Robert produced a pair of deep house singles, and an album, for the American label Cobalt Recordings, which was distributed through various digital download sites
The track "Wash Away" appeared on the Plastic City compilation Deep Train 5, compiled by The Timewriter.
King Moot
The King Moot project first emerged in 2010. The first song to appear under the new moniker was a remix for a Blu Mar Ten compilation.
The name was chosen in order to separate this project from his house music work.
2018 saw the release of the debut album It Just Fell,  a collection of ambient and electronic music.
Between 2020 and 2022, a trio of EPs were released, entitled The Whitman Strategy.
In 2020, the track The Bell Curve appeared on the Context Audio compilation Per Ardua II.
In 2022, an EP of Drum and bass and Dubstep was released for the Context Audio label, called Per Ardua IV.
In 2025, Robert received a song writing credit for the FKA Twigs song HARD, which features on the album Eusexua Afterglow on Atlantic Records.
Discography
* Crushed Elms - Moot Point MP001DIGI (2017)
* It Just Fell - Moot Point MP0002DIGI (2018)
* Vow Sentiments (Gin & French Remix) - Moot Point MP006DIGI (2018)
* Thirty - Moot Point MP007DIGI (2019)
* The Whitman Strategy Part One - Moot Point MP009DIGI (2020)
* The Whitman Strategy Part Two - Moot Point MP010DIGI (2020)
* The Whitman Strategy Part Three - Moot Point MP012DIGI (2022)
* Per Ardua IV - Context Audio CTXIV (2022)
* Hibiscus - Moot Point MP013DIGI (2025)
Other Material
In 2021, Robert briefly returned to his own-name-project to release an Electronic single, called "The Sherbs EP".
In 2023, Robert returned to the project once more, to release a single of atmospheric Drum and bass, titled Old Romantic, written in the style of LTJ Bukem's Good Looking Records. It was coupled with an early jungle track from 1998, Artforms, which was previously unreleased.
